meanings.definition: Used to express frustration or anger.
meanings.sent1: Aargh! I can't find my keys anywhere!
meanings.sent2: Aargh, why is this puzzle so difficult?
meanings.sent3: Aargh, I forgot to bring my umbrella on a rainy day!
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic made him shout 'aargh' in frustration.
meanings.sent5: The loud 'aargh' echoed through the empty hallway.

meanings.definition: A sound of exasperation or distress.
meanings.sent1: She let out an 'aargh' of frustration when her computer crashed.
meanings.sent2: The movie's scary scenes were accompanied by loud 'aarghs' from the audience.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's 'aargh' at bath time was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The 'aargh' of the alarm clock signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The eerie 'aargh' in the dark forest sent shivers down his spine.
